## Validation

This validation document uses the R-package [piamValidation](https://github.com/pik-piam/piamValidation)
to perform a series of different checks on a snapshot of the Scenario MIP modeling results.

These checks are based on the [vetting criteria google doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/11oLs7xfe5aJsgchip6JwzYc3v2hcGCFvRrHHK72ApZs/edit?tab=t.0)
and reformulated to be machine-readable bounds, listed in a [validationConfig](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qYqdC13377HHgCcO_eMq4TJemdLZjsYCM9gzYqD-r8o/edit?gid=596205375#gid=596205375) file. For further information on the validation tool, consult the [online documentation](https://pik-piam.r-universe.dev/articles/piamValidation/validateScenarios.html).

Scenario Snapshot: ``scenarios_scenariomip_2024-12-28.csv``

Historical data: ``historicalR10_2025-14-07.mif``

### Visualization

Interactive line plots and heat maps demonstrate how models stay within the 
defined boundaries. Hovering over data points offers additional data via tool tips 
(e.g. what is the exact reference value). Two levels of "strictness" are used:

![Thresholds](C:/Users/pascalwe/Code/scenarioMIP/piamValidation/inst/figures/thresholds_extracolors.png){#id .class width=70% height=70%}

### Data sources

#### 2020 vetting

- **Final Energy, Primary Energy**: Deviation to IEA data.
- **Emissions|CO2|EIP**: Deviations to CEDS (April 2024).

*Note*: For 2020, the tolerance range includes both the 2020 value and the 2018-2022 average
to allow for models to include or exclude a "COVID dip".

#### Near-term emissions

Deviation to "Medium" Scenario of the respective SSP in 2030.

#### Near-term capacities

Tested against thresholds based on 

- **Hydro**: [IEA HSMR project pipelines](https://github.com/pik-piam/mrremind/discussions/540)
- **Nuclear**: [IAEA PRIS project pipelines](https://github.com/pik-piam/mrremind/discussions/541)
- **Solar**: [BloombergNEF projections](https://github.com/pik-piam/mrremind/discussions/542) (only some regions available)
- **Wind**: [GWEC Global Wind Report](https://github.com/pik-piam/mrremind/discussions/543) (only some regions available)

#### Near-term Carbon Capture

Tested against thresholds based on [IEA CCUS project pipelines](https://github.com/pik-piam/mrremind/discussions/544).

<!-- ## Historical vetting by model -->
```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=6}

interactiveLinplots_model <- function(modelArg = "AIM") {
  valiData <- df %>%
    #revalue.levels(emi.scen = plot.emi.scen.letter) %>%
    filter(model == modelArg,
           period %in% c(2010, 2015, 2020, 2030))
           #variable != "Emissions|CO2|Energy and Industrial Processes")
  
  vars <- unique(valiData$variable)
  
  local_hist <- hist %>%
      filter(variable %in% vars,
             region == "World",
             model %in% c(valiData$ref_model, "Ember", "IEA CCUS"),
             period %in% seq(2005, 2022)) %>%
      mutate(ref_model = model)
  
  local_scen <- dR10 %>%
      #revalue.levels(emi.scen = plot.emi.scen.letter) %>%
      filter(variable %in% vars,
             region == "World",
             model == modelArg,
             period %in% seq(2005, 2030)) %>%
      mutate(scenario = paste0(" ", ssp, gsub("Default|Variant","",def.var)))
  
  plot_list <- htmltools::tagList()
  for (i in 1:length(vars)) {
    var <- as.character(vars[i])
    
    # this plots only the periods which are being validated 
    # (change in validationConfig)
    p <- linePlotThresholds(valiData, var, reg = "World", refData = T)

    # add historical data
    h <- local_hist %>% filter(variable == var)
    p <- p +
      geom_point(data = h, aes(x = period, y = value), #, shape = ref_model),
                 size = 1, color = "black")
    
    # add scenario data
    d <- local_scen %>% filter(variable == var)
    p <- p +
      geom_line(data = d, aes(x = period, y = value, color = emi.scen, linetype = scenario, group = ssp)) +
      scale_color_manual(values = plot.emi.scen.colors)
      #labs(color = "Scenario") +
      #scale_linetype_manual(values = plot.SSP.linetype) +

    plot_list[[i]] <- plotly::ggplotly(p)
  }
  return(plot_list)
}

```


## Historical vetting by scenario narrative
```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=6}

interactiveLinplots_emiScen <- function(emiScen = "VL") {
  valiData <- df %>%
    revalue.levels(emi.scen = plot.emi.scen.letter) %>%
    filter(emi.scen == emiScen,
           period %in% c(2010, 2015, 2020, 2030))
           #variable != "Emissions|CO2|Energy and Industrial Processes")
  
  vars <- unique(valiData$variable)
  
  local_hist <- hist %>%
      filter(variable %in% vars,
             region == "World",
             model %in% c(valiData$ref_model, "Ember", "IEA CCUS"),
             period %in% seq(2005, 2030)) %>%
      mutate(ref_model = model)
  
  local_scen <- dR10 %>%
      revalue.levels(emi.scen = plot.emi.scen.letter) %>%
      filter(variable %in% vars,
             region == "World",
             emi.scen == emiScen,
             period %in% seq(2005, 2030)) %>%
      mutate(scenario = paste0(" ", ssp, gsub("Default|Variant","",def.var)))
  
  plot_list <- htmltools::tagList()
  for (i in 1:length(vars)) {
    var <- as.character(vars[i])
    
    # this plots only the periods which are being validated 
    # (change in validationConfig)
    p <- linePlotThresholds(valiData, var, reg = "World", refData = T)
    
    # add historical data
    h <- local_hist %>% filter(variable == var)
    p <- p +
      geom_point(data = h, aes(x = period, y = value), #, shape = ref_model),
                 size = 1, color = "black")
    
    # add scenario data
    d <- local_scen %>% filter(variable == var)
    p <- p +
      geom_line(data = d, aes(x = period, y = value, color = model, linetype = scenario, group = ssp)) +
      #labs(color = "Scenario") +
      #scale_linetype_manual(values = plot.SSP.linetype) +
      scale_color_manual(values = plot.model.colors)
    
    plot_list[[i]] <- plotly::ggplotly(p)
  }
  return(plot_list)
}
```

```{r, fig.width=10, fig.height=10}
# all following heat maps should not show historic periods in this document
df_heatmap <- df %>%
  filter(period >= 2020)

# when there are several checks for the same variable, display only the more extreme color
# minor issue: if only the max is the violated, hoverbox won't show the min
# issue: if a strict rule is overwritten by a lax rule, we may get unwanted color warnings
df_heatmap <- df_heatmap %>%
  mutate(checkRank = check) %>%
  #revalue.levels(checkRank = validationHeatmap.colorRanks) %>%
  group_by(region,variable,unit,period, model, scenario, value, ssp,emi.scen,def.var) %>%
  filter(checkRank == max(checkRank)) %>%
  select(-checkRank)

```


```{r, modelHeatmap, fig.width=10, fig.height=10}
modelHeatmap <- function(d) {
  d <- d %>%
    filter(metric == "relative", ref_scenario == "historical" | is.na(ref_scenario))
  interact <- TRUE
  
  # interactive plots can only be printed from outside of loops, use tagList
  # to store html objects in List
  if (nrow(d) > 0) {
    models <- unique(d$model)
    plot_list <- htmltools::tagList()
    for (i in 1:length(models)) {
      plot_list[[i]] <- d %>%
        filter(model == models[i]) %>%
        validationHeatmap(main_dim = "model",
                          interactive = interact,
                          titleSuffix = " 2020") %>% 
        # avoid overlap of title and facet labels (plotly issue)
        plotly::layout(title = list(y = .95, xref = "plot"),
                       margin = list(l = 0, t = 150, r = 150))
    }
    return(plot_list)
  }
}
```

## Summary

### World

Counting all checks per model can give teams rough hints towards overall vetting progress.
Take a look at individual heat maps above to see where exactly bound violations happen.
Priority should be given to eliminating ``red`` and ``blue`` data points.

```{r}
df_summary <- filter(df, period >= 2020)
# find "critical == yes" data points of each color
summary <- filter(df_summary, region == "World") %>%
  dplyr::count(model, check) %>%
  mutate(model = substr(model, 1, 5)) %>%
  group_by(model) %>%
  mutate(percent = n / sum(n) * 100)

# change order of colors
summary$check <- factor(
  summary$check, 
  levels = rev(c("green", "yellow", "cyan", "red", "blue", "grey"))
  )

# stacking order and midpoints
summary <- summary %>%
  arrange(model, desc(check)) %>%
  group_by(model) %>%
  mutate(
    cumulative = cumsum(n),
    midpoint = cumulative - (n / 2)
  )


# stacked bar plot in absolute numbers of checks
p1 <- ggplot(summary, aes(x = model, y = n, fill = check)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") + # Absolute stacked bars
  scale_fill_manual(values = validationHeatmap.colors) + # Custom colors
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 0, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 0.5)) +
  geom_text(aes(label = n, y = midpoint), color = "white", size = 3.5) +
  labs(y = "Count", x = "Model")

# normalized
p2 <- ggplot(summary, aes(x = model, y = n, fill = check)) +
  geom_bar(position = "fill", stat = "identity") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = validationHeatmap.colors) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 0, vjust = 0, hjust=0.5)) +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(percent, 1), "%"),
                group = check),
            position = position_fill(vjust = 0.5),
            color = "white",
            size = 3.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +
  labs(y = "Percentage", x = "Model")

p1
p2
```
